commitResults.messageTitle: Completed Level-1, skeletal version of chatbot
Level-2 completed, add and list items
Level-3 completed, mark and unmark functionality
Level-4 Added Todo, Deadline, Event task types
automated UI testing
implemented exception handling, checking for common exceptions
implemented delete functionality
Implement saving of task list to the hard drive
Implement partially the DateTime feature for Event and Deadline
Implements recognising date and time for Event and Deadline as localdatetime objects, with custom output display
Merge Level 7 and Level 8 branches, allowing for functionality of recognising localdatetime and saving of state in master branch
Add duke.txt to gitignore
Refactor the code to use OOP for Ui, Storage, TaskList and Parser classes, distributing the code from driver class
Package java class files under appropriate names
Implement unit testing with Junit for a few methods
Not affect anything substantial, only to include the JAR release
Include javadocs for most non private classes and methods
commitResults.messageBody: To include javadocs for Task related classes at later date

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement the find feature
commitResults.messageBody: Users can now input the find command followed by any number of keywords to search for Tasks that have names containing the search target keywords

commitResults.messageTitle: Modify code to comply with coding standard, minimal changes made, will revisit with checkstyle
Partially implement the GUI
commitResults.messageBody: This commit does not compile. This is just a temporary save point.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement working barebones version of GUI
commitResults.messageBody: Automated regression and unit testing cases need to be completely revamped. They are currently meaningless.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement fully the transition to GUI with relevant FXML files in place
Update Javadocs to be consistent with GUI implementation
Introduce the use of java assertions to verify invariants
commitResults.messageBody:
Several invariants, such as the existence of key objects and the
correctness of arguments when calling certain functions are to be
verified before these functions can be safely called. Otherwise,
there is a chance of undefined or unexpected behavior. This commit
uses java assertions to verify some of these invariants.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code quality, reducing reliance on long chains of if else by replacing it with a switch case, and updating junit test cases
Implement the tagging feature and command, allowing users to specify a list index and add a tag to the event
Improve code quality by abstracting sections of Duke::respondToMessage that was deemed too long, and rectify the fact that I forgot to branch for adding assertions
Improve code quality and resolve issues raised by grader script
Update README.md
Update build.gradle for shadowJar to work
Add a window title to duke
Refactor code slightly for java 11
